quotes.quote: Web analytics is a fire extinguisher. Your website is on fire and you're burning cash.

Designing a website can be a bit like being a kid and inheriting a sweetshop. It's easy to get carried away. There are so many choices. A website can be like an attic that never fills up. Space is not the problem. Attention is.
The vast majority of small business owners want nothing to do with figuring out a website. They are neck-deep in their business trying to keep it going.
Don't think of your website as a self-promotion machine, think of it as a self-invention machine.
The power of a website comes from the people using it, not the people making it.

Remember, the web isn't about control. If a visitor to your site is familiar with using a browser's native form doodad, you won't be doing them any favors if you override the browser functionality with your own widget, even if you think your widget looks better.
A website should be designed such that a visitor should go the cart with confidence and not to your contact page with confusion
Domain names and websites are Internet real estate.
Only astrophysicists new about the Internet 20 years ago. Today my cat has a website.
A website without SEO is like a car with no gas.
A personal website is vital, but it needs to change and evolve.
A bad website is like a grumpy salesperson.
A website is a window through which your business says hello to the world.
I used to have a lot of faith in humanity before the advent of the website "comment" section.
The objective of a website is to bring a visitor who brings another visitor.

If there's one thing you learn by working on a lot of different websites, it's that almost any design ideaâ€”no matter how appallingly badâ€”can be made usable in the right circumstances, with enough effort.
In the information age, build a website before you build a workplace.
Looking at the proliferation of personal web pages on the net, it looks like very soon everyone on earth will have 15 Megabytes of fame.

Good website practice and optimizing for conversion usually makes for good search engine optimization. These work together to ensure you drive quality traffic and can persuade that traffic to help you meet your business goals.
Website without visitors is like a ship lost in the horizon.
When a human being becomes a set of data on a website like Facebook, he or she is reduced. Everything shrinks. Individual character. Friendships. Language. Sensibility.
Websites promote you 24/7: No employee will do that.
Don't forget: when you start a website, it's not yet a trusted site. So you have to bring people from a trusted site to your site to build up the trust in your site.
No one comes to your website to be entertained. They have questions they think you can answer. Content answers questions.
Ultimately, users visit your website for its content. Everything else is just the backdrop.
In the information age, a website can generate such a high income which even a factory cannot generate.
Create a website that expresses something about who you are that won't fit into the template available to you on a social networking site.
If you run a website that doesn't have something that's terrible on it, you are not trying hard enough. You have to fail, fail, fail. You have to fail and fail miserably many times.
Filter a website, and you protect a student for a day. Educate students about online safety in the real world environment, and you protect your child for a lifetime.

People tend to think of the web as a way to get information or perhaps as a place to carry out ecommerce. But really, the web is about accessing applications. Think of each website as an application, and every single click, every single interaction with that site, is an opportunity to be on the very latest version of that application.
